elements.name: applicantServiceAddressIntroExplanation
elements.title: The last part of this step is to decide how and where the the Court should contact you about your `application`.

elements.name: applicantHasLawyer
elements.title: Do you have a lawyer?
elements.description:
If you have a lawyer, this service will assume that you want the Court to contact your lawyer instead of you.

If you have a lawyer, but you would prefer the Court to contact you directly, select "NO".

elements.name: applicantHasLawyerYesError
elements.title: For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations. At this time, this service cannot help you apply for a `Representation Grant`.

elements.name: applicantServiceAddress
elements.title: Where do you want the Court to send you documents if they need to?
elements.description: (also know as an Address for Service)

elements.name: applicantServicePhone
elements.title: What number do you want the Court to call if they have questions?
elements.description:
(also know as a Service Phone Number)
The Court will only call during business hours.

elements.name: applicantServiceEmail
elements.title: What email address do you want the Court to use if they have questions?
elements.description:
(also know as an Email for Service)
If you do not have an email address, please write “No email address”.

elements.name: applicantHasFax
elements.title: Do you have a fax number if the Court needs to send you documents?
elements.description: (also know as a Fax Number for Service)

elements.name: applicantServiceFax
elements.title: What number do you want the Court to fax if they have documents to send you?
elements.description: (also know as a Fax Number for Service)

elements.name: applicantCourthouse
elements.title: Which Supreme Court location do you want to file your documents?

elements.name: applicantExitSpouseOnly
elements.title: Next, this service will help you formally tell people you are applying for a Representation Grant for {deceasedName}.
